name: twingate
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing Twingate cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`twingate` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/Twingate/terraform-provider-twingate).

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing Twingate cloud resources.
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/Twingate/terraform-provider-twingate)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-twingate` repo](https://github.com/Twingate/pulumi-twingate/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-twingate` repo](https://github.com/Twingate/terraform-provider-twingate/issues).

python.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/Twingate/terraform-provider-twingate)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-twingate` repo](https://github.com/Twingate/pulumi-twingate/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-twingate` repo](https://github.com/Twingate/terraform-provider-twingate/issues).

apiToken.description:
The access key for API operations. You can retrieve this from the Twingate Admin Console
([documentation](https://docs.twingate.com/docs/api-overview)). Alternatively, this can be specified using the
TWINGATE_API_TOKEN environment variable.

cache.description: Specifies the cache settings for the provider.

defaultTags.description: A default set of tags applied globally to all resources created by the provider.

httpMaxRetry.description:
Specifies a retry limit for the http requests made. The default value is 10. Alternatively, this can be specified using
the TWINGATE_HTTP_MAX_RETRY environment variable

httpTimeout.description:
Specifies a time limit in seconds for the http requests made. The default value is 35 seconds. Alternatively, this can
be specified using the TWINGATE_HTTP_TIMEOUT environment variable

network.description:
Your Twingate network ID for API operations. You can find it in the Admin Console URL, for example:
`autoco.twingate.com`, where `autoco` is your network ID Alternatively, this can be specified using the TWINGATE_NETWORK
environment variable.

url.description: The default is 'twingate.com' This is optional and shouldn't be changed under normal circumstances.

groupsEnabled.description: Specifies whether the provider should cache groups. The default value is `true`.

resourceEnabled.description: Specifies whether the provider should cache resources. The default value is `true`.

tags.description: A map of key-value pair tags to be set on all resources by default.

groupsEnabled.description: Specifies whether the provider should cache groups. The default value is `true`.

resourceEnabled.description: Specifies whether the provider should cache resources. The default value is `true`.

tags.description: A map of key-value pair tags to be set on all resources by default.

domains.description: A set of allowed domains. Defaults to an empty set.

blockAdultContent.description: Whether to block adult content. Defaults to false.

blockDating.description: Whether to block dating content. Defaults to false.

blockGambling.description: Whether to block gambling content. Defaults to false.

blockGames.description: Whether to block games. Defaults to false.

blockPiracy.description: Whether to block piracy sites. Defaults to false.

blockSocialMedia.description: Whether to block social media. Defaults to false.

blockStreaming.description: Whether to block streaming content. Defaults to false.

enableSafesearch.description: Whether to force safe search. Defaults to false.

enableYoutubeRestrictedMode.description: Whether to force YouTube to use restricted mode. Defaults to false.

domains.description: A set of denied domains. Defaults to an empty set.

blockAdsAndTrackers.description: Whether to block ads and trackers. Defaults to false.

blockAffiliateLinks.description: Whether to block affiliate links. Defaults to false.

blockDisguisedTrackers.description: Whether to block disguised third party trackers. Defaults to false.

blockCryptojacking.description: Whether to block cryptojacking sites. Defaults to true.

blockDnsRebinding.description: Blocks public DNS entries from returning private IP addresses. Defaults to true.

blockDomainGenerationAlgorithms.description: Blocks DGA domains. Defaults to true.

blockIdnHomoglyph.description: Whether to block homoglyph attacks. Defaults to true.

blockNewlyRegisteredDomains.description: Blocks newly registered domains. Defaults to true.

blockParkedDomains.description: Block parked domains. Defaults to true.

blockTyposquatting.description: Blocks typosquatted domains. Defaults to true.

enableGoogleSafeBrowsing.description: Whether to use Google Safe browsing lists to block content. Defaults to true.

enableThreatIntelligenceFeeds.description: Whether to filter content using threat intelligence feeds. Defaults to true.

approvalMode.description: This will set the approval model on the edge. The valid values are `AUTOMATIC` and `MANUAL`.

groupId.description: Group ID that will have permission to access the Resource.

securityPolicyId.description: The ID of a `twingate.getTwingateSecurityPolicy` to use as the access policy for the group IDs in the access block.

usageBasedAutolockDurationDays.description: The usage-based auto-lock duration configured on the edge (in days).

serviceAccountId.description: The ID of the service account that should have access to this Resource.

policy.description: Whether to allow or deny all ports, or restrict protocol access within certain port ranges: Can be `RESTRICTED` (only listed ports are allowed), `ALLOW_ALL`, or `DENY_ALL`

ports.description: List of port ranges between 1 and 65535 inclusive, in the format `100-200` for a range, or `8080` for a single port

policy.description: Whether to allow or deny all ports, or restrict protocol access within certain port ranges: Can be `RESTRICTED` (only listed ports are allowed), `ALLOW_ALL`, or `DENY_ALL`

ports.description: List of port ranges between 1 and 65535 inclusive, in the format `100-200` for a range, or `8080` for a single port

hostname.description: The hostname of the machine hosting the Connector.

id.description: The ID of the Connector.

name.description: The Name of the Connector.

remoteNetworkId.description: The ID of the Remote Network attached to the Connector.

state.description: The Connector's state. One of `ALIVE`, `DEAD_NO_HEARTBEAT`, `DEAD_HEARTBEAT_TOO_OLD` or `DEAD_NO_RELAYS`.

statusUpdatesEnabled.description: Determines whether status notifications are enabled for the Connector.

enableYoutubeRestrictedMode.description: Whether to force YouTube to use restricted mode.

blockAdsAndTrackers.description: Whether to block ads and trackers.

blockDisguisedTrackers.description: Whether to block disguised third party trackers.

blockDnsRebinding.description: Blocks public DNS entries from returning private IP addresses.

enableGoogleSafeBrowsing.description: Whether to use Google Safe browsing lists to block content.

enableThreatIntelligenceFeeds.description: Whether to filter content using threat intelligence feeds.

id.description: The ID of the Group

isActive.description: Indicates if the Group is active

name.description: The name of the Group

securityPolicyId.description: The Security Policy assigned to the Group.

id.description: The ID of the Remote Network.

location.description: The location of the Remote Network. Must be one of the following: AWS, AZURE, GOOGLE*CLOUD, ON*PREMISE, OTHER.

name.description: The name of the Remote Network.

type.description: The type of the Remote Network. Must be one of the following: REGULAR, EXIT.

policy.description: Whether to allow or deny all ports, or restrict protocol access within certain port ranges: Can be `RESTRICTED` (only listed ports are allowed), `ALLOW_ALL`, or `DENY_ALL`

ports.description: List of port ranges between 1 and 65535 inclusive, in the format `100-200` for a range, or `8080` for a single port

policy.description: Whether to allow or deny all ports, or restrict protocol access within certain port ranges: Can be `RESTRICTED` (only listed ports are allowed), `ALLOW_ALL`, or `DENY_ALL`

ports.description: List of port ranges between 1 and 65535 inclusive, in the format `100-200` for a range, or `8080` for a single port

address.description: The Resource's IP/CIDR or FQDN/DNS zone

approvalMode.description: The Approval Mode of the Resource. The valid values are `AUTOMATIC` and `MANUAL`.

name.description: The name of the Resource

protocols.description: Restrict access to certain protocols and ports. By default or when this argument is not defined, there is no restriction, and all protocols and ports are allowed.

remoteNetworkId.description: Remote Network ID where the Resource lives

tags.description: The `tags` attribute consists of a key-value pairs that correspond with tags to be set on the resource.

usageBasedAutolockDurationDays.description: The number of days that the Resource will be locked after the last successful login.

policy.description: Whether to allow or deny all ports, or restrict protocol access within certain port ranges: Can be `RESTRICTED` (only listed ports are allowed), `ALLOW_ALL`, or `DENY_ALL`

ports.description: List of port ranges between 1 and 65535 inclusive, in the format `100-200` for a range, or `8080` for a single port

id.description: Return a matching Security Policy by its ID. The ID for the Security Policy can be obtained from the Admin API or the URL string in the Admin Console.

name.description: Return a Security Policy that exactly matches this name.

id.description: ID of the Service Account resource

keyIds.description: List of twingate*service*account_key IDs that are assigned to the Service Account.

name.description: Name of the Service Account

resourceIds.description: List of twingate.TwingateResource IDs that the Service Account is assigned to.

email.description: The email address of the User

firstName.description: The first name of the User

id.description: The ID of the User

lastName.description: The last name of the User

role.description: Indicates the User's role. Either ADMIN, DEVOPS, SUPPORT, or MEMBER.

type.description: Indicates the User's type. Either MANUAL or SYNCED.

provider.description:
The provider type for the twingate package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

twingate:index/twingateDNSFilteringProfi.description:
DNS filtering gives you the ability to control what websites your users can access. DNS filtering is only available on certain plans. For more information, see Twingate's [documentation](https://www.twingate.com/docs/dns-filtering). DNS filtering must be enabled for this resources to work. If DNS filtering isn't enabled, the provider will throw an error.

## Import

```sh
$ pulumi import twingate:index/twingateDNSFilteringProfile:TwingateDNSFilteringProfile example RG5zRmlsdGVyaW5nUHJvZmlsZToxY2I4YzM0YTc0
```

allowedDomains.description: A block with the following attributes.

contentCategories.description: A block with the following attributes.

deniedDomains.description: A block with the following attributes.

fallbackMethod.description: The DNS filtering profile's fallback method. One of "AUTO" or "STRICT". Defaults to "STRICT".

groups.description: A set of group IDs that have this as their DNS filtering profile. Defaults to an empty set.

name.description: The DNS filtering profile's name.

priority.description: A floating point number representing the profile's priority.

privacyCategories.description: A block with the following attributes.

securityCategories.description: A block with the following attributes.

priority.description: A floating point number representing the profile's priority.

privacyCategories.description: A block with the following attributes.

twingate:index/twingateResource:Twingate.description:
Resources in Twingate represent servers on the private network that clients can connect to. Resources can be defined by IP, CIDR range, FQDN, or DNS zone. For more information, see the Twingate [documentation](https://docs.twingate.com/docs/resources-and-access-nodes).

## Import

```sh
$ pulumi import twingate:index/twingateResource:TwingateResource resource UmVzb3VyY2U6MzQwNDQ3
```

accessServices.description: Restrict access to certain service account

address.description: The Resource's IP/CIDR or FQDN/DNS zone

alias.description: Set a DNS alias address for the Resource. Must be a DNS-valid name string.

approvalMode.description: This will set the approval model for the Resource. The valid values are `AUTOMATIC` and `MANUAL`.

isActive.description: Set the resource as active or inactive. Default is `true`.

isBrowserShortcutEnabled.description: Controls whether an "Open in Browser" shortcut will be shown for this Resource in the Twingate Client. Default is `false`.

isVisible.description: Controls whether this Resource will be visible in the main Resource list in the Twingate Client. Default is `true`.

name.description: The name of the Resource

protocols.description: Restrict access to certain protocols and ports. By default or when this argument is not defined, there is no restriction, and all protocols and ports are allowed.

remoteNetworkId.description: Remote Network ID where the Resource lives

securityPolicyId.description: The ID of a `twingate.getTwingateSecurityPolicy` to set as this Resource's Security Policy. Default is `Default Policy`.

tags.description: A map of key-value pair tags to set on this resource.

tagsAll.description: A map of key-value pairs that represents all tags on this resource, including default tags from provider configuration.

usageBasedAutolockDurationDays.description: The usage-based auto-lock duration for the Resource (in days).

The name of the Service Account in Twingate

expirationTime.description: Specifies how many days until a Service Account Key expires. This should be an integer between 0 and 365 representing the number of days until the Service Account Key will expire. Defaults to 0, meaning the key will never expire.

name.description: The name of the Service Key

serviceAccountId.description: The id of the Service Account

token.description: Autogenerated Service Key token. Used to configure a Twingate Client running in headless mode.

isActive.description: Determines whether the User is active or not. Inactive users will be not able to sign in.

role.description: Determines the User's role. Either ADMIN, DEVOPS, SUPPORT or MEMBER.

sendInvite.description: Determines whether to send an email invitation to the User. True by default.
sendInvite.deprecationMessage: This attribute is no longer used and will be removed in a future release.

pulumi:providers:twingate/terraformConfi.description: This function returns a Terraform config object with terraform-namecased keys,to be used with the Terraform Module Provider.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getTwingateConnector.

id.description: The ID of the Connector. The ID for the Connector can be obtained from the Admin API or the URL string in the Admin Console.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getTwingateConnector.

hostname.description: The hostname of the machine hosting the Connector.

id.description: The ID of the Connector. The ID for the Connector can be obtained from the Admin API or the URL string in the Admin Console.

name.description: The name of the Connector.

remoteNetworkId.description: The ID of the Remote Network the Connector is attached to.

state.description: The Connector's state. One of `ALIVE`, `DEAD_NO_HEARTBEAT`, `DEAD_HEARTBEAT_TOO_OLD` or `DEAD_NO_RELAYS`.

statusUpdatesEnabled.description: Determines whether status notifications are enabled for the Connector.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getTwingateConnectors.

name.description: Returns only connectors that exactly match this name. If no options are passed it will return all connectors. Only one option can be used at a time.

nameContains.description: Match when the value exist in the name of the connector.

nameExclude.description: Match when the exact value does not exist in the name of the connector.

namePrefix.description: The name of the connector must start with the value.

nameRegexp.description: The regular expression match of the name of the connector.

nameSuffix.description: The name of the connector must end with the value.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getTwingateConnectors.

nameExclude.description: Match when the exact value does not exist in the name of the connector.

namePrefix.description: The name of the connector must start with the value.

nameRegexp.description: The regular expression match of the name of the connector.

nameSuffix.description: The name of the connector must end with the value.

fallbackMethod.description: The DNS filtering profile's fallback method. One of AUTOMATIC or STRICT.

groups.description: A set of group IDs that have this as their DNS filtering profile. Defaults to an empty set.

id.description: The DNS filtering profile's ID.

name.description: The DNS filtering profile's name.

priority.description: A floating point number representing the profile's priority.

privacyCategories.description: A block with the following attributes.

securityCategories.description: A block with the following attributes.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getTwingateGroup.

id.description: The ID of the Group. The ID for the Group can be obtained from the Admin API or the URL string in the Admin Console.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getTwingateGroup.

id.description: The ID of the Group. The ID for the Group can be obtained from the Admin API or the URL string in the Admin Console.

isActive.description: Indicates if the Group is active

name.description: The name of the Group

securityPolicyId.description: The Security Policy assigned to the Group.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getTwingateGroups.

isActive.description: Returns only Groups matching the specified state.

name.description: Returns only groups that exactly match this name. If no options are passed it will return all resources. Only one option can be used at a time.

nameContains.description: Match when the value exist in the name of the group.

nameExclude.description: Match when the exact value does not exist in the name of the group.

namePrefix.description: The name of the group must start with the value.

nameRegexp.description: The regular expression match of the name of the group.

nameSuffix.description: The name of the group must end with the value.

types.description: Returns groups that match a list of types. valid types: `MANUAL`, `SYNCED`, `SYSTEM`.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getTwingateGroups.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getTwingateRemoteNetwork.

id.description: The ID of the Remote Network

name.description: The name of the Remote Network

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getTwingateRemoteNetwork.

id.description: The ID of the Remote Network

location.description: The location of the Remote Network. Must be one of the following: AWS, AZURE, GOOGLE*CLOUD, ON*PREMISE, OTHER.

name.description: The name of the Remote Network

type.description: The type of the Remote Network. Must be one of the following: REGULAR, EXIT.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getTwingateResource.

id.description: The ID of the Resource. The ID for the Resource can be obtained from the Admin API or the URL string in the Admin Console.

protocols.description: By default (when this argument is not defined) no restriction is applied, and all protocols and ports are allowed.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getTwingateResource.

address.description: The Resource's address, which may be an IP address, CIDR range, or DNS address

approvalMode.description: The Approval Mode of the Resource. The valid values are `AUTOMATIC` and `MANUAL`.

id.description: The ID of the Resource. The ID for the Resource can be obtained from the Admin API or the URL string in the Admin Console.

name.description: The name of the Resource

protocols.description: By default (when this argument is not defined) no restriction is applied, and all protocols and ports are allowed.

remoteNetworkId.description: The Remote Network ID that the Resource is associated with. Resources may only be associated with a single Remote Network.

tags.description: The `tags` attribute consists of a key-value pairs that correspond with tags to be set on the resource.

usageBasedAutolockDurationDays.description: The number of days that the Resource will be locked after the last successful login.

type.description: Indicates the User's type. Either MANUAL or SYNCED.
